metadata.title: CVE-2023-1670 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw use after free in the Linux kernel Xircom 16-bit PCMCIA (PC-card)Ethernet driver was found.A local user could use this flaw to crash thesystem or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1670` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-5.15.0-75-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic - 5.15.0-75.82
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-75-generic-64k - 5.15.0-75.82
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-45-generic - 5.19.0-45.46~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-45-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-45.46~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-45-generic - 5.19.0-45.46~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-45-generic-64k - 5.19.0-45.46~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1035-kvm - 5.15.0-1035.40
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-75.82').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-45.46~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1035.40').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1038.43').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1040.47').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-6.2, was needed').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1041.48.1').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1036.44').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1036.41').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.27').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1032.35').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1033.38').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-75.82').
linux-lowlatency-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-lowlatency-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1037.43').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1032.33').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1017.17').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1009.9').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1032.35').
linux-azure-fde-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-fde-6.2, was needed').
linux-xilinx-zynqmp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-oem-6.5 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
